smc:area.name: MALPrototype
smc:area.comment: The MALPrototype area defines data types, services and operations used to test the proper implementation of the MAL requirements.

smc:service.name: IPTest
smc:service.comment:
This service aims at testing each Interaction Pattern (IP). It provides one operation for Send, Submit, Request, Invoke and Progress. The input parameter is an IPTestDefinition that contains:
- The parameters used by the consumer in order to initiate the interaction. These parameters enable the provider to check whether the received message header is correct or not.
- A list of interaction transitions expected by the consumer.
An operation 'getResult' is provided in order to enable the consumer to get:
- the interaction transaction identifier
- and the assertions evaluated on the provider side during an interaction.
Finally four operations 'monitor', 'publishUpdates' and 'publishError' are provided in order to test the Pub/Sub interaction.

smc:sendIP.name: send
smc:sendIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and check that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1).

smc:submitIP.name: testSubmit
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 3.1.1.1).

smc:requestIP.name: request
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 3.1.1.1).

smc:invokeIP.name: invoke
smc:invokeIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 3.1.1.1).

smc:progressIP.name: progress
smc:progressIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 3.1.1.1).

smc:pubsubIP.name: monitor
smc:pubsubIP.comment: This operation initiates a Pub/Sub interaction. It is not implemented by the service provider but by a broker.

smc:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

smc:requestIP.name: getResult
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation returns an IPTestResult.

smc:submitIP.name: publishUpdates
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, publishes an update as specified by the parameter TestPublishUpdate and checks the header of the Publish message (see 4.1.3). Moreover if an error is expected by the TestPublishUpdate then the operation hangs until a Publish error is raised or a timer ends (see 4.1.10). The header of the Publish error message is checked (see 4.1.4).

smc:submitIP.name: publishRegister
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishRegister and checks the header of the Publish Register message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishRegister, it checks the header of the Publish Register acknowledgement message (see 4.1.6). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Register error message (see 4.1.7).

smc:submitIP.name: publishDeregister
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishDeregister and checks the header of the Publish Deregister message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishDeregister, it checks the header of the Publish Deregister acknowledgement message (see 4.1.8). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Deregister error message (see 4.1.9).

smc:sendIP.name: sendMulti
smc:sendIP.comment: This operation duplicates the send operation with an additional IN parameter.

smc:submitIP.name: submitMulti
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation duplicates the testSubmit operation with an additional IN parameter.

smc:requestIP.name: requestMulti
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation duplicates the request operation with an additional IN parameter.

smc:invokeIP.name: invokeMulti
smc:invokeIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 4.1.2).

smc:progressIP.name: progressMulti
smc:progressIP.comment: This operation duplicates the progress operation with an additional IN parameter.

smc:pubsubIP.name: monitorMulti
smc:pubsubIP.comment: This operation duplicates the monitor operation with an additional IN parameter.

smc:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

smc:requestIP.name: testRequestEmptyBody
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that an empty body can be sent and received explicitly for a request pattern

smc:invokeIP.name: testInvokeEmptyBody
smc:invokeIP.comment: This operation checks that an empty body can be sent and received explicitly for an Invoke pattern

smc:progressIP.name: testProgressEmptyBody
smc:progressIP.comment: This operation checks that an empty body can be sent and received explicitly for a Progress pattern

smc:service.name: DataTest
smc:service.comment:
This service aims at testing the data structures.
It provides an operation 'testData' that enables to transmit any Element to the provider and check that it is well interpreted by the provider.

smc:submitIP.name: setTestDataOffset
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation sets the index into the test list for the testData operation. Passing non positive values resets it to the start of the list.

smc:requestIP.name: testData
smc:requestIP.comment: The 'testData' operation allows a consumer to check that a data is correctly decoded on the provider side, then that the same data sent back by the provider is correctly decoded on the consumer side. The provider needs to statically know the list of data that the consumer is going to send. The consumer selects the data in the same order as the list and calls the operation 'testData'. The provider keeps the index of the currently selected data from the static list. When the operation 'testData' is called, the provider checks that the received data is equal to the selected data from the list. If the equality test fails, then the error DATA_ERROR is raised, otherwise the provider returns the decoded data. When the consumer receives the returned data, it checks that this data is equal to the original data it sent.

smc:requestIP.name: testDataBlob
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Blob type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataBoolean
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Boolean type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataDouble
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Double type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataDuration
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Duration type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataFineTime
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic FineTime type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataFloat
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Float type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataIdentifier
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Identifier type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataInteger
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Integer type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataLong
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Long type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataOctet
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Octet type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataShort
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Short type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataString
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic String type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataTime
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Time type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataURI
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic URI type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataComposite
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a composite type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataEnumeration
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a enumeration type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataList
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataUInteger
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic UInteger type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataULong
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic ULong type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataUOctet
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic UOctet type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testDataUShort
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic UShort type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testExplicitMultiReturn
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that multiple types can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testAbstractMultiReturn
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that multiple types with a final abstract type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testEmptyBody
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that an empty body can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testMalAttribute
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a MAL::Attribute can be sent and received as an abstract Attribute

smc:requestIP.name: testMalComposite
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a Composite can be sent and received as a MAL Composite. It is no longer used in the testbed.

smc:requestIP.name: testAbstractComposite
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a Composite can be sent and received as an abstract Composite. It is no longer used in the testbed.

smc:requestIP.name: testMalAttributeList
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list of MAL::Attribute can be sent and received explicitly. It is no longer used in the testbed.

smc:requestIP.name: testMalElementList
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list of MAL::Element can be sent and received explicitly. It is no longer used in the testbed.

smc:requestIP.name: testMalCompositeList
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list of MAL::Composite can be sent and received explicitly. It is no longer used in the testbed.

smc:requestIP.name: testAbstractCompositeList
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list of abstract composite can be sent and received explicitly. It is no longer used in the testbed.

smc:requestIP.name: testDataObjectRef
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic ObjectRef type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testInnerAbstractMultiReturn
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that multiple types with a not final abstract type can be sent and received explicitly

smc:requestIP.name: testPolymorphicAbstractCompositeList
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that various concrete values can be sent and received explicitly as a list of abstract composite

smc:requestIP.name: testPolymorphicMalCompositeList
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that various concrete values can be sent and received explicitly as a list of MAL Composite

smc:requestIP.name: testPolymorphicMalElementList
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that various concrete values can be sent and received explicitly as a list of MAL Element

smc:requestIP.name: testPolymorphicObjectRefTypes
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation checks the ObjectRef(T) polymorphism in operation type signature and in composite fields

smc:requestIP.name: createObject
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation creates a new MO Object from a full value

smc:requestIP.name: createObjectFromFields
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation creates a new MO Object from fields values

smc:submitIP.name: deleteObject
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation deletes an MO Object

smc:requestIP.name: getObject
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation gets an MO Object value from its reference

smc:service.name: ErrorTest
smc:service.comment: This service aims at testing the MAL errors. It doesn't need to be implemented as it is only used on the consumer side to make the transport layer raise errors (see section 3.3).

smc:requestIP.name: testDeliveryFailed
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testDeliveryTimedout
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testDeliveryDelayed
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testDestinationUnknown
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testDestinationTransient
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testDestinationLost
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testEncryptionFail
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testUnsupportedArea
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testUnsupportedOperation
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testUnsupportedVersion
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testBadEncoding
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testUnknown
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testAuthenticationFailure
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the MAL layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:requestIP.name: testAuthorizationFailure
smc:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the MAL layer before the provider is invoked.

smc:pubsubIP.name: monitor
smc:pubsubIP.comment: This operation initiates a Pub/Sub interaction. It is not implemented by the service provider but by a broker.

smc:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

smc:submitIP.name: publishUpdates
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, publishes an update as specified by the parameter TestPublishUpdate and checks the header of the Publish message (see 4.1.3). Moreover if an error is expected by the TestPublishUpdate then the operation hangs until a Publish error is raised or a timer ends (see 4.1.10). The header of the Publish error message is checked (see 4.1.4).

smc:submitIP.name: publishRegister
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishRegister and checks the header of the Publish Register message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishRegister, it checks the header of the Publish Register acknowledgement message (see 4.1.6). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Register error message (see 4.1.7).

smc:submitIP.name: publishDeregister
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishDeregister and checks the header of the Publish Deregister message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishDeregister, it checks the header of the Publish Deregister acknowledgement message (see 4.1.8). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Deregister error message (see 4.1.9).

smc:field.name: procedureName
smc:field.comment: Name of the test procedure that evaluated the assertion.

smc:field.name: Info
smc:field.comment: Message explaining what the assertion checks.

smc:field.name: Result
smc:field.comment: Boolean indicating whether the assertion succeeded (true) or not (false).

smc:field.name: procedureName
smc:field.comment: Name of the test procedure that evaluated the assertion.

smc:field.name: Info
smc:field.comment: Message explaining what the assertion checks.

smc:field.name: Result
smc:field.comment: Boolean indicating whether the assertion succeeded (true) or not (false).

smc:composite.name: IPTestDefinition
smc:composite.comment: This abstract structure is inherited by all the IP test definition structures.

smc:field.name: procedureName
smc:field.comment: Name of the test procedure

smc:field.name: consumerURI
smc:field.comment: The consumer's URI

smc:field.name: authenticationId
smc:field.comment: The authentication identifier used by the consumer

smc:field.name: Qos
smc:field.comment: The QoS level required by the consumer

smc:field.name: Priority
smc:field.comment: The priority level required by the consumer

smc:field.name: Domain
smc:field.comment: The domain used by the consumer

smc:field.name: networkZone
smc:field.comment: The network zone used by the consumer

smc:field.name: Session
smc:field.comment: The type of the session used by the consumer

smc:field.name: sessionName
smc:field.comment: The identifier of the session used by the consumer

smc:field.name: supplements
smc:field.comment: The supplements field used by the consumer

smc:field.name: transitions
smc:field.comment: The transitions that are requested by the consumer

smc:field.name: timestamp
smc:field.comment: The time the consumer initiated the interaction.

smc:composite.name: IPTestTransition
smc:composite.comment: This structure is used to define an expected transition from an IP test. It asserts what transition is expected and what result is expected from the transition: successful or failure.

smc:field.name: Type
smc:field.comment: The type of the transition to do

smc:field.name: errorCode
smc:field.comment: The code of the error expected to be raised when doing the transition (failed transition).-1 if no error is expected (successful transition).

smc:composite.name: BadHeaderReport
smc:composite.comment: This data structure is an error report produced after having found a faulty header.

smc:field.name: expectedHeader
smc:field.comment: The expected header

smc:field.name: faultyHeader
smc:field.comment: The header that is not compliant with the MAL rules

smc:composite.name: TestPublish
smc:composite.comment: This abstract structure is a publish context.

smc:field.name: Qos
smc:field.comment: The QoS level to be used by the provider.

smc:field.name: Priority
smc:field.comment: The priority to be used by the provider.

smc:field.name: domain
smc:field.comment: The domain to be used by the provider.

smc:field.name: networkZone
smc:field.comment: The network zone to be used by the provider.

smc:field.name: Session
smc:field.comment: The session type to be used by the provider.

smc:field.name: sessionName
smc:field.comment: The session name to be used by the provider.

smc:field.name: testMultiType
smc:field.comment: Whether to use the multi type version of the PubSub operation.

smc:composite.name: TestPublishRegister
smc:composite.comment: This data structure specifies how the IPTest provider shall register.

smc:field.name: keyNames
smc:field.comment: The names of the keys to be used by the broker.

smc:field.name: keyTypes
smc:field.comment: The types of the keys to be used by the broker.

smc:field.name: errorCode
smc:field.comment: The code of the Publish Register error expected to be received.-1 if no Publish Register error is expected.

smc:composite.name: TestPublishDeregister
smc:composite.comment: This data structure specifies how the IPTest provider shall register.

smc:field.name: errorCode
smc:field.comment: The code of the Publish Deregister error expected to be received.-1 if no Publish Deregister error is expected.

smc:composite.name: TestPublishUpdate
smc:composite.comment: This data structure specifies how the IPTest provider shall publish an update.

smc:field.name: updateHeaders
smc:field.comment: The headers of the updates to be published by the provider

smc:field.name: updates
smc:field.comment: The updates to be published by the provider

smc:field.name: keyValues
smc:field.comment: The list of key values

smc:field.name: errorCode
smc:field.comment: The code of the Publish error expected to be received.-1 if no Publish error is expected.

smc:field.name: isException
smc:field.comment: Indicates whether the error is returned as an Exception or a Publish Error message

smc:field.name: failedKeyValues
smc:field.comment: The list of failed keys values.

smc:composite.name: TestUpdate
smc:composite.comment: This data structure defines an Update published by the IPTest.

smc:field.name: Counter
smc:field.comment: A counter used to distinguish the test updates and to check the ordering.

smc:field.name: URIfrom
smc:field.comment: The consumer's URI

smc:field.name: transactionId
smc:field.comment: The transaction identifier of the interaction

smc:field.name: interactionType
smc:field.comment: The type of the interaction

smc:field.name: Service
smc:field.comment: The name of the called service

smc:field.name: operation
smc:field.comment: The name of the called operation

smc:field.name: transactionId
smc:field.comment: The transaction identifier assigned to the last interaction

smc:field.name: assertions
smc:field.comment: The list of assertions checked by the provider.

smc:composite.name: MessageHeader
smc:composite.comment: The MessageHeader structure is used to hold all fields that are passed for each message exchanged between a consumer and provider. See 4.1 for more information.

smc:field.name: URIfrom
smc:field.comment: Message Source URI

smc:field.name: authenticationId
smc:field.comment: Source Authentication Credentials

smc:field.name: URIto
smc:field.comment: Message Destination URI

smc:field.name: timestamp
smc:field.comment: Message generation timestamp

smc:field.name: QoSlevel
smc:field.comment: The QoS level of the message

smc:field.name: priority
smc:field.comment: The QoS priority of the message

smc:field.name: domain
smc:field.comment: Domain of the message

smc:field.name: networkZone
smc:field.comment: Network zone of the message

smc:field.name: session
smc:field.comment: Type of session of the message

smc:field.name: sessionName
smc:field.comment: Name of the session of the message. Shall be LIVE if session type is LIVE.

smc:field.name: interactionType
smc:field.comment: Interaction Pattern Type

smc:field.name: interactionStage
smc:field.comment: Interaction Pattern Stage

smc:field.name: transactionId
smc:field.comment: Unique to consumer

smc:field.name: area
smc:field.comment: Service Area Identifier

smc:field.name: service
smc:field.comment: Service Identifier

smc:field.name: operation
smc:field.comment: Service Operation Identifier

smc:field.name: version
smc:field.comment: Service version

smc:field.name: isError
smc:field.comment: True if this is an error message else False.

smc:composite.name: Auto
smc:composite.comment: An abstract object type for cars. This type and all derived types are notably used in the Polymorphic types test procedure related to ObjectRef.

smc:field.name: engine
smc:field.comment: The engine of the car.

smc:field.name: chassis
smc:field.comment: The chassis of the car.

smc:field.name: windows
smc:field.comment: The windows of the car.

smc:composite.name: Lamborghini
smc:composite.comment: The object representing a Lamborghini car.

smc:composite.name: Porsche
smc:composite.comment: The object representing a Porsche car.

smc:composite.name: Garage
smc:composite.comment: The object representing a Garage with multiple references and lists of references to cars.

smc:field.name: courtesyCarAsPorsche
smc:field.comment: The Porsche courtesy car offered by the garage.

smc:field.name: courtesyCarAsAuto
smc:field.comment: The courtesy car offered by the garage.

smc:field.name: courtesyCarAsObject
smc:field.comment: The courtesy car offered by the garage.

smc:field.name: carsAsPorsches
smc:field.comment: The list of Porsche cars parked in the garage.

smc:field.name: carsAsAutos
smc:field.comment: The list of cars parked in the garage.

smc:field.name: carsAsObjects
smc:field.comment: The list of cars parked in the garage.

smc:composite.name: TestObjectBase
smc:composite.comment: An abstract MO Object structure.

smc:field.name: firstItem
smc:field.comment: Example String item.

smc:field.name: secondItem
smc:field.comment: Example Integer item.

smc:composite.name: TestObject
smc:composite.comment: A concrete MO Object structure which does not extend directly the MAL Object type.

smc:field.name: thirdItem
smc:field.comment: Another example String item.

smc:field.name: fourthItem
smc:field.comment: Example Boolean item.

smc:composite.name: TestBody
smc:composite.comment: An concrete composite example used to build complex composite structures.

smc:field.name: firstItem
smc:field.comment: Example String item.

smc:field.name: secondItem
smc:field.comment: Example Integer item.

smc:composite.name: AbstractComposite
smc:composite.comment: An abstract composite example. This type and all derived types are notably used in the Polymorphic types test procedure.

smc:field.name: firstItem
smc:field.comment: Example String item.

smc:field.name: secondItem
smc:field.comment: Example Integer item.

smc:composite.name: ComplexStructure
smc:composite.comment: A concrete composite example extending an Abstract composite with some common fields.

smc:field.name: third_item
smc:field.comment: Extra Boolean item.

smc:field.name: fourth_item
smc:field.comment: Example Integer item.

smc:field.name: last_item
smc:field.comment: Contained structure.

smc:composite.name: BasicAbstractComposite
smc:composite.comment: A concrete composite example extending an Abstract composite with no field.

smc:composite.name: StructureWithAbstractField
smc:composite.comment: A concrete composite example extending an Abstract composite with a field which is itself an Abstract composite, allowing for defining complex instances.

smc:field.name: abstract_item
smc:field.comment: Contained abstract structure.

smc:field.name: third_item
smc:field.comment: Extra Boolean item.

smc:field.name: fourth_item
smc:field.comment: Example Integer item.

smc:pubsubIP.name: monitor
smc:pubsubIP.comment: This operation initiates a Pub/Sub interaction. It is not implemented by the service provider but by a broker.

smc:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

smc:pubsubIP.name: monitor2
smc:pubsubIP.comment: This operation initiates a Pub/Sub interaction. It is not implemented by the service provider but by a broker.

smc:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

smc:submitIP.name: publishUpdates
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, publishes an update as specified by the parameter TestPublishUpdate and checks the header of the Publish message (see 4.1.3). Moreover if an error is expected by the TestPublishUpdate then the operation hangs until a Publish error is raised or a timer ends (see 4.1.10). The header of the Publish error message is checked (see 4.1.4).

smc:submitIP.name: publishRegister
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishRegister and checks the header of the Publish Register message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishRegister, it checks the header of the Publish Register acknowledgement message (see 4.1.6). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Register error message (see 4.1.7).

smc:submitIP.name: publishDeregister
smc:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishDeregister and checks the header of the Publish Deregister message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishDeregister, it checks the header of the Publish Deregister acknowledgement message (see 4.1.8). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Deregister error message (see 4.1.9).
